From Wiktionary, the free dictionary
See also: pulli

Finnish

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Probably from the Germanic word for "bull" (Proto-Germanic *bulô), potentially through a dialectal word, or borrowed directly as a name from a Germanic language.[1]

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /ˈpulːi/, [ˈpulːi]
  • Rhymes: -ulːi
  • Syllabification(key): Pul‧li
  • Hyphenation(key): Pul‧li

Proper noun

[edit]

Pulli

  1. a Finnish surname

Derived terms

[edit]
  • Pulliainen
  • Pullinen

Statistics

[edit]
  • Pulli is the 648th (tied with 4 other surnames) most common surname in Finland, belonging to 1,307 individuals, according to August 2025 data from the Digital and Population Data Services Agency of Finland.

References

[edit]
  1. ^ Mikkonen, Pirjo; Paikkala, Sirkka (2000), Sukunimet, Helsinki: Otava, →ISBN

German

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Clipping of Pullover +‎ -i.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /ˈpʊli/
  • Audio (Germany (Berlin)):(file)
  • Hyphenation: Pul‧li
  • Rhymes: -ʊli

Noun

[edit]

Pulli m (strong, genitive Pullis, plural Pullis)

  1. (colloquial) alternative form of Pullover

Declension

[edit]
Declension of Pulli [masculine, strong]
singular plural
indef. def. noun def. noun
nominative ein der Pulli die Pullis
genitive eines des Pullis der Pullis
dative einem dem Pulli den Pullis
accusative einen den Pulli die Pullis

Further reading

[edit]
  • “Pulli” in Duden online
  • “Pulli” in Digitales Wörterbuch der deutschen Sprache
